description: Create a new project called calunga-ui
steps: A calunga-ui directory is created
Look at the trustify-ui project. Create a project using similar libraries and structure

description: calunga-ui
steps: Look at the Red Hat branding in the trustify-ui project. Create a similar branding in the calunga-ui project with the text 'Trusted Developer Libraries'.

description: calunga-ui navigation
steps: Look at the side bar and navigation in the trustify-ui project. Create a similar setup for calunga-ui
Add an entry for 'Python Wheels'

description: calunga-ui Python Wheels page
steps: Create a Python Wheels page in the calunga-ui project
Add a filter toolbar, see the trustify-ui project for reference
The toolbar should have a filter search bar where users can select what filter they want. These filter values should be related to Python wheels
Add a filter for classification
Add a filter for Platform
Add a filter for Source Index
Add a table with the following headers: 'Wheel', 'Version', 'ABI', 'Platform', 'License', 'Published', 'Source Index'
Clicking on a table header should result in the table contents being filtered by that header value
I have included a 'calunga-ui.png' file in this directory you can use as reference.

description: Fix the error that occurs when running npm run start:dev
steps: Inspect the error that occurs in calunga-ui when running npm run start:dev
Fix that issue so the app starts without issue

description: Fix weird branding in calunga-ui
steps: Inspect the branding used in rhtas-console-ui and apply similar changes to calunga-ui
Inspect the calunga-ui.png file if you need a reference on what this branding should look like
I'm specifically referring to the branding that is above the side bar
The wording should stay the same but the format should change
The branding in the header.tsx file in calunga-ui should be updated to the desired output

description: calunga-ui Python Wheels page has populated dummy data
steps: Look at the table entries in the 'calunga-ui.png' file.
Populate the calunga ui Python Wheels page table with dummy data that match these entries.
The dummy data should come from a simple json file that the table uses and is easy to edit.

description: The table headers that sort the data should work
steps: Look at the table headers in the calunga-ui
ALL table column headers should have some sort functionality that actually works on the data and sorts the table
The dummy data should be fully rendered

description: Each dummy data entry should have a description
steps: Populate each dummy data entry with a description

description: Each table entry should be Expandable
steps: Each table entry should be Expandable
Each table entry, when expanded, displays the dummy data description

description: Each table row header sorts the table entries
steps: Each table row header sorts the data in the table
The table updates and shows this newly-sorted data

description: Each table row header sorts the table entries
steps: Each table row header sorts the data in the table
The table updates and shows this newly-sorted data

description: Masthead is too small
steps: Triple the size of the masthead

description: font size is too small
steps: Double the font size

description: Investigate difference between rhtas-console-ui font sizing and calunga-ui
steps: The calunga-ui project has to explicitly set the font size but the rhtas-console-ui has the correct sizing without a global.css file
Investigate why rhtas-console-ui is rendering font sizing correctly and calunga-ui is not
Update calunga-ui once a reason has been determined.

description: Update this project so the application can be rendered in Github Pages
steps: The calunga-ui project needs to be able to render in a Github pages page
Investigate how this can be transformed so it renders in a Github pages page
Perform any necessary changes for the goal

description: Update the search filter so it can search by actual value used in the dummy data
steps: Search filter options are options that can be used to filter the dummy data, with the exception of 'Name' which filters by the python wheel name
The table updtes as the user types in the search bar with a delay of 400ms

description: Nothing is rendered at https://cryptorodeo.github.io/calunga-ui-demo/python-wheels
steps: The github page is now deployed but nothing renders, investigate why and fix the issue.
The header title is rendered as <%= branding.application.title %> which seems incorrect. This might be a clue.

description: The github page is now deployed, but the masthead does not render properly
steps: It looks like the masthead file is missing or something related to it is missing, I see a broken file link where it should be
Investigate if anything related to how Github pages is deployed could cause this
Investigate what could cause this if it's not related to Github pages
Investigate by reviewing what is returned at https://cryptorodeo.github.io/calunga-ui-demo/

description: Clicking on the Python Wheels side nav button leads to https://cryptorodeo.github.io/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/python-wheels?itemsPerPage=10&pageNumber=1&sortColumn=wheel&sortDirection=asc
steps: The github page is now deployed but the side bar nav causes an issue, investigate why and fix the issue.
When on the root page nothing is rendered correctly also, so maybe this is realted
Update any code needed to fix the issue
Invesitgate by reviewing what happens when you go to https://cryptorodeo.github.io/calunga-ui-demo/python-wheels . You should see a redirect

description: Clicking on the Python Wheels side nav button keeps redirecting to https://cryptorodeo.github.io/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/python-wheels?itemsPerPage=10&pageNumber=1&sortColumn=wheel&sortDirection=asc
steps: Clicking on 'Python Wheels' on the side bar nav causes the folllowing link to be rendered: https://cryptorodeo.github.io/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/calunga-ui-demo/python-wheels?itemsPerPage=10&pageNumber=1&sortColumn=wheel&sortDirection=asc
The github page is now deployed but the side bar nav causes an issue, investigate why and fix the issue.
This is how it's rendered on Github pages: Python Wheels

description: The masthead-logo.svg text is incorrect
steps: The masthead-logo.svg text should say: Trusted Developer Libraries

description: app should use vite over rsbuild
steps: The calunga-ui project should use vite over rsbuild, similar to how its done in rhtas-console-ui

description: masthead missing after refactoring to vite
steps: The masthead is missing after moving the app to vite. Investigate why and resolve the issue.

description: Github page is empty and white
steps: Visting the github page yields an empty white page, no content is rendered: https://cryptorodeo.github.io/calunga-ui-demo/
